website_summaries.verdict: A choice that will not disappoint. This amp gives the warm, full sound that you want, and it’s sturdy yet lightweight. Very little downside.
pros: It is both an amp and a DAC, so it will outperform your computer’s DAC, for improved sound quality
The solid construction is surprising for such a compact component
Sound quality is more crisp than most low-cost alternatives
cons: The lightweight design can lead to excessive movement and unplugging if bumped
This can cause frustrating interruptions to your listening experience

customer_reviews.title: An appropriately priced and sturdy workhorse DAC
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this little guy for over a year now and it's working as solidly as it did on day one. It just sits on my desk at work and does it's duty day after day. This is the first external DAC I've ever owned and I'm certainly pleasantly surprised at it's ability to appropriately drive my Marshall Monitor headphones. For the price I am extremely happy with my purchase and would do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Cory L.

customer_reviews.title: Great DAC/amp for the price
customer_reviews.text: Swapped out my Creative G5 for this USB DACamp. +This USB DAC/amp will appear to Windows 10 as a SPDIF interface. You can use the volume knob to control the amplifier output level while independently adjusting volume within Windows. +Noise floor is imperceptible at my workstation. +Everything sounds as it should, no weird pops when a sound starts playing or during low frequency base that plagued my old DAC. +Package comes with a strip ofwhich provide enough friction to secure the product on a table. -The blue LED. It is so bright that you can barely read the volume markings in ambient room lighting. The dial is not see through so the blue light doesn't help in the dark either.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Died after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product about 6 months. In the last two months, a small amount of static began to creep in when I changed the volume and this morning I got silence. I've purchased two amp/dacs from FIIO, both have died after 3~6 months. Lesson: Don't by FIIO. I know it can be financially annoying to spend more money than you expected, but a good amp should last at least as long as a *few* pairs of headphones (3~5 years. I've had my sennheisers 10 years, shures for 3 years, and beyerdynamics for 1 year and the FIIO amps should have lived to power all of them). TLDR; Don't buy FIIO. Buy something from Schiit Audio, Audioquest, or Chord.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Velarde

customer_reviews.title: Typical garbage
customer_reviews.text: Not satisfied at all with the product. Stay clear. PROS -price CONS - sent a usb power only cable; device depends on driver installation/recognition by data and power cable. Took me half an hour to debug the issue - Fiios support forum is a sorry joke. No quality on advice from "technicians" - Sound is average. Not what I expected - Lacks a p2 line in for mobiles.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Berzins

customer_reviews.title: An FPS Gamer's Point-of-View
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use specifically with my new gaming desktop. The difference is night and day. After moving my Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro 80 OHM headset from my motherboard to the FiiO E10K, Battlefield 1 came to life... The ambience of distance battle is spooky. Touching off a round at an enemy soldier produces an accurate snap like it should. If you close your eyes it feels as though you've been transported to no-man's-land. I definitely do not regret this purchase. Using this DAC while playing competitive titles such as CS:GO gives you a distinct advantage as you can pinpoint individual footsteps. The sound of the AWP on this DAC is jaw dropping.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Green

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well with higher impedance headphones 300 ohm and up
customer_reviews.text: It did not work well with my Sennheiser hd650s so I decided to return it since that is all I needed it for although I'm sure it works fine with lower impedance headphones. I was also disappointed to see that Amazon recommends this for the headphones when the spec sheet (which you can see when you get it) says that it is better suited for lower impedance headphones, so just an fyi it will not "good" for said headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Mattack

customer_reviews.title: You’re better off streaming sound through your controller
customer_reviews.text: This only works with usb devices. The main reason I purchased this was to stream music from MP3 player to DAC to headphones. Come to find out there’s no audio in port. Luckily I needed a USB DAC for my computer. My speakers would produce a horrid buzz. This fixed the problem. I was also curious about my PlayStation 4, the DAC doesn’t completely setup right. The audio at full blast is quieter and weaker. You’re better off streaming sound through your controller. This littler thing is impressive. Though my first day had many cons I can’t argue with the quality of the sound coming from my headphones and theater system now.
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: Build Quality Issues
customer_reviews.text: Pretty bummed about this. I have been looking at reviews of this model for such a long time and finally pulled the trigger for desk. When I got the unit, the USB port was so sensitive that the slightest movement would cause it to short out. Even changing the volume would cause this. I would also have to plug it in over and over to get it to show up on the output list on my Mac. The unit felt so good in hand and then just didn’t work in use. I love the other Fiio DAC I have so I was pretty bummed about this. :/
customer_reviews.author: TechNerd

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought sooner! Great Amp/DAC for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I love music, and good sound quality but I wouldn’t consider myself as an audiophile either. I have a pair of ATH-M50Xs and I noticed a huge difference once using this product! Especially when also listening to lossless “Hi-Fi” quality music, the difference Is pretty huge! I have several other headphones I’d like to buy now! But for the price it’s well worth it if you are looking to get better sound from your headphones!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great DAC both w/ Headphone Amp and Line Out...Great for a Desktop setup
customer_reviews.text: Superb sound! Love how I can run both headphones and (active/powered) speakers from this device from this device. It really makes a huge sonic difference on my Logitech THX speakers. The original sound card on my desktop machine simply did not have the dynamic and aural range to properly render the music. The FiiO E10K made both my headphones and speakers come to life. Truly amazing...You can't go wrong with this. On a side note, I'm even able to play music from my iPad via the Apple Lightning to USB 3.0 Camera Adapter (need to add power into the female lightning connector...10 watts) and power my headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Should improve most digital music.
customer_reviews.text: I am playing MP3 files from iTunes on my iMac, through a Klipsh 2.1 speaker system and Sony MDR 7506 phones. My goal was to get as close as possible to the expensive set up I had in the seventies, playing vinyl, for as little money as possible. This DAC adds some punch, clarity (especially through the speakers) and is generally flat and pleasing... I'm into the whole package for about $275.00 and I'm quite pleased with the result.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Finn

customer_reviews.title: Yeah!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, just wow. This just blew me out of my socks. I have a HP Beats laptop. So I was a bit worried. The audio is supposed to be good on that one. Would there be any improvement? Well, I got this box and hell yeah! That is way better. I am now listening to the Red Hot Chili Peppers Parallel Universe. It just gives me heart palpitations, I am completely in there. I have never enjoyed this song as much as I am hearing it right now. I am happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Wytze

customer_reviews.title: Very good first or long term dac/amp combo.
customer_reviews.text: If the JDSLABS ODAC is much better than this. Then I can't imagine how great that is, since this is so good. This is 10x better than noisy onboard motherboard audio even though I have what is supposed to be very good audio. It drives my DT990 PRO's even though its max is only 150 Ohms but they are 250 Ohm. The mids, bass, and treble are all clear and separated. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a first amp/dac before jumping into the deep end of the audiophile world. It is a long expensive jump!
customer_reviews.author: HarrisR

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive DAC
customer_reviews.text: I needed a DAC for work since my headphones need more than what an onboard dac can offer. It drives the headphones well enough (do not need to turn it past "5" on the high gain mode) and I cannot really hear any sort of gain issues (distortion). It is pretty small, easy to carry around. It is powered by a micro USB cable. It's all in all pretty great. A tube DAC will of course sound better but if you need something small profile to drive higher impedance headphones, this is your guy.
customer_reviews.author: Ringooooooooo

customer_reviews.title: I don't know why Fiio bothers to be in business
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst USB device I've ever got. USB-C on a PowerMac using two dongles. It randomly shuts off as if the USB contacts don't make contact, and then HDMI flickers and all your screens move around. You have to manually go back to sound control panel and select Fiio if (big if) the device auto-detects when plugged back in. The audio is really harsh and doesn't compare to my Little Dot MK III tube amp, so the sound signature isn't even worth the trouble of using this thing. I returned it to Amazon and I just use the headphone jack unless I'm at home with my tube amp now.
customer_reviews.author: bad sellers suck

customer_reviews.title: this DAC seemed to make my headphones sound worse. Sturdy and nice materials
customer_reviews.text: I listened to my HD650s and DT770s through this for a few months. I decided to go directly into my PC a few days ago and noticed a HUGE improvement in sound. For whatever reason, this DAC seemed to make my headphones sound worse. Sturdy and nice materials, but failed to improve sound quality of my headphones. Actually made them sound worse.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: It's not more then ok
customer_reviews.text: So I got this DAC-Amp a few months ago and use them with the headphones Sennheiser HD 598. I have a few things to say about them. For the price, it's not a good DAC-Amp. I will give it maybe a $50 price and that's because you can find a better DAC-Amp more advanced at a $70 price. The sound quality is not great, it's basic and not improving sound, only Amplifier. The bass feels very bad, and on %80 of sound, it will make the sound quality sounds terrible and unprofessional. For the price, FX-AUDIO DAC X6 better option then the Fiio E10K.
customer_reviews.author: ShaharM

customer_reviews.title: Powered all my cans, (monolith m1060c, HD 6XX ...
customer_reviews.text: Powered all my cans, (monolith m1060c, HD 6XX, sensitive iem's) without issue, the only thing to take into account if this is your full time amp/dac is its size. it's tiny and controlling the volume needs two hands. (one to hol the amp, the other to turn the dial, very small, lightweight) no noise or static, clean transparent sound and enough power for most mid-fi cans available without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Serina_

customer_reviews.title: Terrible micro usb connector.
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this is great, but the micro usb connector is terrible and falls out constantly. I wasn't immediately discouraged since I had a lot of micro usb connectors of my own I could use. But they didn't work with the amp for some reason, which didn't really make sense to me. Great amp, connector falls out all the time and sometimes doesn't fully connect leading to audio artifacts. Its just a really large problem stemming from something which should be easily solved. I tried using tape to keep the connector in, but when I did that I got audio artifacts for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Works great and better sound quality
customer_reviews.text: This made a decent improvement in sound quality for my HE400i and KZ ZS10 Pros. I cant hear any hissing, harshness, etc. Plenty of juice to run the HE400is far above listening volume as well. It worked well with my macbook pro and some USB-C adapter to microUSB. I cant say much about portability aside from the size being pretty nice and compact, I'm sure it would fit in my pocket with a phone.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: I am blown away for the price
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible. For the price it is unbeatable value. When you have this plugged in and your phones on with nothing playing you can hear how fine this device is. There is no background noise at all. No hum or hiss or crackles to be found. Then you turn on your favorite game or movie or your music and the sound is just incredible. This is one great product.
customer_reviews.author: A D Lynch

customer_reviews.title: My Beats Studio3's  are getting ran at the full potential with this DAC.
customer_reviews.text: My computer speakers headphone jack died. The regular headphone jack on the pc isn't amplified, So i purchased this. I have a set of the Beats Studio3 Wireless. I initially was using a Bluetooth transmitter to plug into this and it degraded the signal big time. I plugged it directly into the DAC and holy crap this thing bangs my studios and it's clear as heck... I was kinda back and forth about spending $76 for this but I am completely impressed with this little device...
customer_reviews.author: ASE MASTER TECH

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I'm not entirely sure what ALL a DAC is supposed to do, but what I do know is that my headphones were annoyingly quiet plugging into my Asrock Z170 Pro4s. PUBG or any FPS game I would be struggling to hear footsteps, when I got my new Z370 board it came with a USB DAC plug, but I also ordered this as well, and can now turn my games up plenty loud enough that I do not struggle to hear enemies moving nearby.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great in the beginning, but degraded after a year
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for sixteen months. In the beginning, it worked great, but over time, it's degraded. At this point, it adds some distortion to the signal, and the left side intermittently loses volume. It's not the headphones, because another adapter works great. I don't think it's the connector, either; it seems like some component in the device is failing. Typically, this would be a capacitor, but I haven't opened it up to diagnose it, and I don't intend to -- I'll just get some higher-quality brand converter.
customer_reviews.author: Jon E Watte

customer_reviews.title: Micro USB is worthless.
customer_reviews.text: Literally on my second Amp because the Micro USB keeps failing on me. Literally would never recommend this amp to anyone because of the poor choice of the micro USB. The plug it self is super loose, and causes a faulty connection. And I can't hear through both of my head phones. Only the left one is currently working. I've had issues with it ever since I've gotten it. Anyone looking to get this product beware of the cheap connection for the power cable. The unit itself works great for powering Studio Quality Headphones, like the Sennheiser 598 or 599s, but the fact that any little bump to the amp makes it cut out power is infuriating.
customer_reviews.author: A Woket

customer_reviews.title: It's not the best around, but it can work.
customer_reviews.text: So close yet so far. Offers a good amount of features but it's just too expensive for what it offers. Holds up well in terms of quality but it gets blown out of the water when it comes to a regular audio interface. Some are the same price or just a bit more and do way more than this little guy can. It's probably meant for the portability and in those regards, yes it does its job and feels quite solid as well. Can't recommend if you're looking for the best bang for your buck, though.
customer_reviews.author: Azim Pathan

customer_reviews.title: Breaks after a few months of use due to cheap microusb port.
customer_reviews.text: The very cheap micro usb port seems to be defective as my DAC will no longer connect to any of my PC's after failing periodically over the last month. For 75 dollars this is unacceptable. The audio jack out port is in a bad location as anytime you go to move the volume knob the light dac is going to slide around. This issue combined with weak microusb port will cause it to surely fail. Don't buy this junk if this was a 20 dollar device it would be a different story. I will never buy a Fiio product again this seems like a recurring issue for this device.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Kremer

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: This little USB amp sound great until it starts to overload. I'm not sure what the issue is exactly but if the amp is plugged in for more than about an hour or so, it begins to crackle. The issue won't resolve itself until it is unplugged and plugged back in. When it is working, however, this amp makes my Beyerdynamic DT 990s sing! A notable difference in clarity and loudness compared to my PC's standard output. So I'm still able to get some good use out of it, but the crackling issue is obviously a problem.
customer_reviews.author: K. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Well built, Very simple yet delivers everything it promises.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say, It's a very simple DAC\AMP, built from solid brushed aluminium, lightweight and small to carry around. Sound quality is great, but make sure you turn everything to 100% volume on your device and use the provided slider to control the volume instead. also be sure you connect it to headphone icon plug and not any other one. It requires no drivers\additional actions, it is 100% plug & play. So far I would recommend this if you're looking for a cheap (relatively) yet reliable sound card solution.
customer_reviews.author: AmitKilo

customer_reviews.title: My Experience with the Fiio E10K
customer_reviews.text: The Fiio E10K is a decent DAC/AMP; however, I had an issue where sound would occasionally create a blasting hissing noise until I unplugged and plugged it back in. I tried multiple USB ports and they all did it on occasion. It got to be very annoying over time although it happened only about once a day. I do believe you are much better off spending about $20 extra and following zReview’s suggestions on DAC/AMP’s on YouTube as he is a leader in audiophile reviews. I will be returning this and going with a different product as this is not worth the money with this issue and it’s a small and barely noticeable jump from onboard audio.
customer_reviews.author: Kris E.

customer_reviews.title: Causes BSOD's if you have too many Audio Streams
customer_reviews.text: This works fine for light use cases, but if you're editing video or something and hopping around the editor a lot or running multiple softwares that need audio output, this thing causes Bluescreens in Windows 10. It's hard to pinpoint this as the problem, but it causes USBXHCI.SYS and ntoskrnl.exe related Blue Screen of Death
customer_reviews.author: Jake S

customer_reviews.title: Whine fix!
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is great. While listening to the music I would say it's pretty much the same as my integrated sound card, which is "ALC1150" on "z97x gaming 3" motherboard. However, when playing games, there is a lot of noise (I suspect my GPU - known as coil whine). Having little sound box outside the tower solves the problem in 100%. Now when it's quiet, there is no sound distortion !
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great little USB Dac/amp
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for money, very good sound quality, significantly better than most PC's on-board sound. Eliminates of a lot of distortion in comparison to the headphone out socket of most PCs or laptops. Makes listening to Spotify etc more enjoyable. Able to drive most headphones to reasonable levels, even 600ohm DT880's. Sound signature is fairly neutral and pleasing. Small portable and easy to use. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brice Gijsbertsen

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it’s great.
customer_reviews.text: After about 3 weeks of ownership it started to have static on the line, unplugging and plugging it back in fixes it for 15-30 minutes. Spoke with support, their resolution was to send me a return label for refund, not replacement but just refund, honestly would have been fine with replacement but this must be a known issue. Guess I’m gonna find a different USB DAC to go with. :/
customer_reviews.author: Damon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wanting the option for an inline volume knob, and better audio quality. It really does beat onboard audio and especially on older/cheaper devices. Currently using it to bypass the damaged audio outputs on a motherboard that had a bad power supply unit cause it harm, and it works perfectly. From my experience it allows you to hear more of whats going on, adds a cleaner bass and doesn't seem to add any bias to the audio aside from the bass switch function.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Was great for about a year, but now it's a dud
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in early 2018 to override a bad sound card in a laptop. Worked great for that and gave me a decent boost in audio quality too (paired with Audio Technica M50s). A year later however, and despite switching it to my stationary desktop, the connections started to fail until now it doesn't work. I knew it was a cheaper alternative to some of the more expensive ones out there, but a year is a little short to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small chassis BIG POWER
customer_reviews.text: Paired with my Audio Technica ATH AD700X I was impressed with sure volume. I had to turn it down to around 6. I wasnt so sure when I opened the box. The unit itself is on the small size. Coming from the land of Astro A40' and A50's 3rd and 4th Gen. I was impressed with sound quality. Glad I made the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel A. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Constant BSOD's, does not work with my DAW in 64bit.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for an hour or so (a bit better than laptop sound, I have 250 Ohm headphones, DT990s.) before it inevitably will BSOD my Windows 10 laptop. Windows 10 is fully up to date. Apparently isn't compatible with ASIO in my 64bit DAW. Driver issues are unbearable. I had to return this.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: The audio on my desktop was a tad too low for my liking, often resulting in videos having maxed out volume and still struggling to hear low notes. I bought this product in the hope it would fill my needs and it has exceeded my expectations thus far. Audio is louder, clearer, and basseyer. Not to mention this frees up my 3.5mm headphone jack for external speakers if I need to. The build quality is also, not surprisingly, sturdy and the dimensions are a lot smaller than I had expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kingsland

customer_reviews.title: ... for about 2 months now and it is a wonderful little thing
customer_reviews.text: Been using this amp daily for about 2 months now and it is a wonderful little thing. It plugs directly into any usb port, and it causes my HD 650s to roar. So far I can't say anything bad about this product. I do wish that it had a native 6.5mm headphone input, but that doesn't really take away from the amplifier itself. edit: after doing more i found out it does work on other machines, so it's not the amp itself. So i can't give it a bad review.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Three years and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought the Fiio E10k three years ago to power my AKG 7XX. The combo has been great and I use it almost every single day. It does its job and sits comfortably under my monitor without taking up any room. To this day, I haven't had an issue yet. There is not much more to say other than it's a great little performer!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Broke in <5 Months
customer_reviews.text: Bought it on February 17th, it’s now broken as of July 3rd. To my own surprise, while listening to music on my 58X Jubilee switched from Low to High gain for the first time ever and not even 5 minutes after putting it down my music crackles and goes silent and a smell of burning fills my room. To my surprise, the micro-usb hub on the Dac/AMP has shorted. I was using the front USB 3.0 port for power/connection to my desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Ruggiano

customer_reviews.title: A good upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I have been using some Bose Companion 2 desktop speakers for a few years now. Often when watching videos on Netflix or other sources the audio would be too quiet with everything turned all the way up. However, on some content they would go far louder than I needed them to. With this DAC I am able to push them a lot louder on the quieter content. Works perfectly, small and solid feel. Bass and gain controls make a very noticeable difference.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: 8/10 Sound Quality, Very annoying and bright blue light
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality could use a bit more clarity, also the blue light is WAY too bright, i have no idea why its made that way. Also wouldve liked it a bit smaller Overall 7/10
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: paired with mh-30, brought it back to life
customer_reviews.text: bought these to use with my audio technica m-30; not sure if those are discontinued. they were pretty good but i never really realized how much i had to turn up the volume to listen to friends on skype or ventrilo for gaming. i decided to pair this amp with the headphones and man are they so much clearer AND louder. i'm not a super audiophile but i can tell for sure that this item really helped bring my headphones back to life. no distortion or static for me. everything is good and dandy. the build itself on this small badboy is also pretty good. seems made of all metal and sturdy too. definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Cute, functional placebo
customer_reviews.text: I’m skeptical on most audio equipment because I don’t believe my own ears are that good but the placebo is really working for me on this one. I definitely feel an extra oomph now, but I unfortunately can’t pull out all the buzzwords about how rich and ungrainy the soundstage on these bla bla. It just sounds a bit better which is about what I expected. It’s also surprisingly small, fits neatly in my hand. Was expecting it to be more aesthetically tech-y but instead it’s just really cute, which is of course also neat. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great DAC for the price point
customer_reviews.text: This DAC is pretty great. I own two - one for home, and one for the office. AKG K702 at home, ATH-M50x at work. They both sound great through this DAC. The newer models seem to have an 'off' function that my first one did not - that is, you can actually switch the unit OFF when not in use. Not that it sucks a lot of power, but definitely a nice seemingly undocumented feature of the newer stock. I'd highly recommend these small, light, and rugged DACs.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Schiesser

customer_reviews.title: Loved It Until....
customer_reviews.text: I love this DAC, FiiO makes super great products. Then out of nowhere, it started SHOOTING OUT STATIC INTO MY HEADPHONES out of nowhere. it hurt so bad I started crying. It happens so randomly. I lost some hearing too because it was so loud. It really sucked. lol. I tried new cables, new everything, different ports. nothing randomly, boom. shooting static.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Diaz-Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get loud enough
customer_reviews.text: I have many reviews saying that this amp was great for powering DT 990 Pro 250ohm headsets so I took the chance. After plugging them in and setting them up I couldn't get them loud enough. With the dial on 10 and the Windows volume set to max there were a lot of videos/movies that I could barely hear. I looked on various sites and found that this is not unique to me. I think it's just a poor quality control issue because some swear by the product and say it gets to ear bleeding levels. Others are like me and can't get them loud enough. Buy at your own risk and pray you get a correctly made unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin  D Calvey

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty good with the beyer dt770 headphones
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty good with the beyer dt770 headphones, but i'd like just a bit more power out of it. i'm running the 80 ohm version of the 770, and i am wishing this had just a bit more power. but overall, the unit does very well.
customer_reviews.author: K1n3k

customer_reviews.title: This makes it nice because when off my system switches to speakers
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these and they work well. I do not use the HP jack and use them to drive tube amps instead. I do notice a different behavior between the two. The first one I bought, when you turn it off, it is disconnected from the USB port. This makes it nice because when off my system switches to speakers. When I switch it on, the system goes to the FIIO. My second one stays connected to USB even when turned off. So now I have to manually switch between speakers of the FIIO. Not sure why there is a difference. Still like them both though.
customer_reviews.author: Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Drivers aren't updated and it will crash your computer (E10K)
customer_reviews.text: It sounds great especially if you have open back headphones because it brings that extra sound they lack here's the bad thing: drivers haven't been updated in a while it crashed my computer everyday for almost two years and windows didn't recognize what it was so after months and months of troubleshooting and swapping parts that didn't needed change I decided to upgrade my amp/dac guess what? my computer never crashed again tested it on my laptop and within an hour it blue screened spend $25 more and get a liquid spark at least
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: I love this DAC for a few reasons. The first is the sound quality. It drives my headphones LOUD and improves the sound quality over a plain 3.5mm input. I also love the size. This thing is small and doesn't take up much room on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Reid Zuerlein

customer_reviews.title: Great for bass heads
customer_reviews.text: Makes all of your sound more full. Bass was more punchy and bass boost add a lot more bass. I am not a huge fan of a lot of bass, but if you want extra bass this product is for you. I would only recommend to people who love listening to music and have at least one pair of headphones that are $100 or more. I have the Sennheiser hd558 and Audio-Technica ath-m50x.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: This thing sounds great and the compact size is excellent
customer_reviews.text: This thing sounds great and the compact size is excellent. Unfortunately, the micro usb port on the back is terribly designed and is too large. If you move the DAC or the cable AT ALL the device loses it's connection to the PC. I tried 4 different cables and it was obviously the DAC in the end. A shame because it sounds GREAT. I would only recommend if you will never, ever come anywhere near it.
customer_reviews.author: Spence

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play, great sound, couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first venture into external DAC use and I must say that I'm extremely pleased. I simply plugged the FIIO E10K into my desktop computer (HP 270 Slim Line with Windows 10) and it automatically set the unit up. The sound is fantastic! I'm using 1 More Quad Driver IEM's. The sound stage is wide and I'm hearing sounds that before I didn't know were there. Please just spend the $75, you'll be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Sackett

customer_reviews.title: Great for any Beginner audiophile.
customer_reviews.text: First of all im not an audiophile. Being my first step into audio gear i half expected a huge upgrade, what i got at first was something that felt flat and lacking of bass. I realized 2 things, one is i needed to burn in the device, and the next is that most things i compare it too have bloated bass that my ear has been trained to be used too. Given this a chance i feel im now starting to enjoy it more and cant wait to buy some better headphones to pair with it. No thrills here just clean audio, get used to it!
customer_reviews.author: JonnyJ

customer_reviews.title: Good, but could be a lot better
customer_reviews.text: First off, this dac is insanely light (to a fault) and doesn't have any non-slip rubber feet. I had to use scotch tape to ensure it wouldn't fly all over my desk anytime I turned my head. Secondly, when I tap the metal housing, it sounds almost hollow (which is probably why it is so light). Sound quality is decent for the price and will likely sound loads better than your on-board sound. But for $76, the build quality is pretty horrendous. It honestly feels like it would have costed $30
customer_reviews.author: Noah Pilcher

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: It works and sounds good to my ears. Fits the bill nicely for my usage, which is plugging into a laptop (running Ubuntu 15.10). It's fairly small and just requires the one USB connection to the laptop. Basically just becomes part of my headphone cable. My only complaint is the LED on the thing is really bright and obnoxious. I know designers love their sexy, blue LEDs, but for everyday use blue LEDs are the most noticeable and thus most annoying LED color.
customer_reviews.author: BeatsMcKickenstein

customer_reviews.title: Awsome budget headphone amp/dac!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first headphone amp/dac I ever got. I have it paired with a Sennheiser HD 518, which is also my first audiophile headphones. Together this headphone amp makes my headphones sound really great for both playing videogames and listening to music. It practically eliminates all static and muffled noises in the background. As a result my headphones produce a much more detailed and crystal clear sound when playing videogames and listening to music than what the onboard soundcard on my computer can do. I'm glad I decided to get a dedicated headphone amp/dac to go along with a nice pair of headphones because it really does make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound for 12 hours! Then faulty micro-usb connection.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to power my AKG K702s. The sound was amazing for the price, but after 12 hours of use the micro usb refused to make a full connection. I know it was the amp, not my pc or the cord, because I tried multiple cords and usb ports. It stopped transmitting left channel audio. I'm returning this and replacing it with a Monoprice for $15 more dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Zak Johnson

customer_reviews.title: So far, I like them but....
customer_reviews.text: I'm just a rookie when it comes to audio and DAC's. I use to use my Yamaha Pre Amp to get audio to my HD 700's but, I was having issues with it. So I purchased this. The Sound quality in my opinion improved. This little box makes a difference. Now it might be an entry level DAC for my audiophiles but, I think they sound even better now.
customer_reviews.author: Rolando Alina

customer_reviews.title: all the difference
customer_reviews.text: Love this little guy. I bought a pair of 990s for primarily gaming and listening to music. So im speaking more based on my exp with that headset. Anyway, definitely best combo ive ever listen to and have been recommending to all my friends. I can personally hear footsteps and other animation in game that i never could prior to having this Dac. Not to mention its so small, it sits on my desk out of the way. It comes with little feet so it doesnt slide off. Best part is, literally just plug in- play... no software etc.
customer_reviews.author: Meh

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get this product to work. Item arrived in seemingly good condition. I tried a windows 10 PC, a Macbook running El Capitan, and a Macbook running High Sierra. None of the machines recognized the device. Tapping the cable would result in the power light randomly shutting off.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Solid little amp, but not portable
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid little amp, but it's best suited for desktop use. Despite claims the contrary, it's really not that portable. About the size of a pack of cigarettes, so it's bulky to carry in your pocket with a phone.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Nice on laptops, not on PCs
customer_reviews.text: Used to work fine on a laptop when I bought it in February. However, once I changed my work station to a newly built PC, I am constantly plagued by popping noises for all sound that comes through. I have confirmed the USB DAC is the issue, and not the headphones, as there is no popping noises once I plug headphones directly into the AUX.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Kim

customer_reviews.title: Drivers don't work right
customer_reviews.text: Recently, across several PC's, the device has stopped working with windows giving the error not enough USB resources, without even all of the ports on either computer being used. They released a driver that ruined the product or windows updated and ruined it
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Rose

customer_reviews.title: I'm limited to a laptop which had rather bad sound output
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at work for a pair of ATH-A900x. I'm limited to a laptop which had rather bad sound output, so I decided to buy this amp. All in all, the bass boost provides a minor increase on bass alone, however the sound output is much cleaner than anything my work laptop could produce. I would compare the quality to be just about the same as my desktop's soundcard (Asus Xonar DX). It doesn't produce a phenomenally difference in sound, however at this price point, I wasn't expecting it to. I'd definitely recommend this if you're running headphones for something without a decent dedicated dac.

customer_reviews.title: NOT a Headphone Amplifier
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a Headphone Amplifier. It must be connected to USB and will not plug into a headphone jack. The overall quality of the amplifier appears to be very good, but it is not the type of device I needed.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: with how much better and cleaner it sounds compared to the onboard soundcard ...
customer_reviews.text: This little DAC has surprised me, to be honest, with how much better and cleaner it sounds compared to the onboard soundcard in the Dell laptops I use. While it does support 96kHz from Windows I was slightly disappointed that it does not natively support DTS Audio or Dolby Digital (maybe that is just expected for external DACs?). Regardless, I would definitely buy this again and I will probably buy a second one to use at home.
customer_reviews.author: B.H.

customer_reviews.title: don't buy it, search for another one
customer_reviews.text: the quality is great most of the time BUT it's sad to see its other side. 1)The sound glitches sometimes and cause a really LOUD buzzing (im 100 sure it's not from my headphones). 2)another times the sound goes off and when i unplug it and plug it again, there are always 2 chances, first, your pc crashes and you get a blue screen OR the pc does not detect the DAC. im really disappointed i have been living with these issues for over 3 months to the point where i don't recommend buying one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, they make my evo 681 from super lux ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, they make my evo 681 from super lux sound even more amazing. My motherboard does not have a good audio chipset and amp so I bought this and so far they make the bass sound amazing, I can finally hear my pc perfectly and I am juts using the lowest setting (about 1 and 2 ) to amplify. I should had bought this before.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend but not for other options
customer_reviews.text: Sounds a lot better than my computer, also really like the bass switch definently not a gimic there. I’ve heard the smsl equivalent is better not sure which one check out Z Reviews on YouTube but I think the Fiio E10K has more power but the smsl has a cleaner sound
customer_reviews.author: Gracin S.

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: If I could give zero stars I would This platform is a total joke and should be pulled from the market asap..... What a piece of junk..... Also It has been returned
customer_reviews.author: R.L.Sellz

customer_reviews.title: Good value, but started hissing after 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: A solid performer for the price. Miles above the built-in audio of my laptop, and it serves its purpose as a replacement for my desktop's front-panel audio (which died). Unfortunately, after a little under 2 years of use, I'm noticing some hissing when turning the volume knob, so I'll be retiring and getting an upgrade. Would've been nice if it lasted longer :/
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Lin

customer_reviews.title: Makes my AKGs sound amazing! I loved my AKGs but felt they lacked ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes my AKGs sound amazing! I loved my AKGs but felt they lacked a bit on the bass but with this, it sounds full and punchy
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Digital Sound in a Small Package.
customer_reviews.text: I use the E10K DAC with laptops and other computers in lieu of the internal sound card or large converter box. It fits nicely in a laptop bag. The sound quality and output power is excellent, good enough for audio and video editing. Because it is digital and outside the computer case, it is much quieter than the analog computer output. The E10K has a pre-fader line output which can be used to drive a more powerful headphone amplifier. There are no batteries. The E10K is powered from the USB port. The case is entirely metal, including the volume knob.
customer_reviews.author: Edward A. Ingold

customer_reviews.title: Works great while it lasts!
customer_reviews.text: Very good improvement over any integrated Realtek sound chip on modern motherboards. Bass boost switch is a nice feature as well. However, the device failed after about 8 months of usage whereby Windows will not recognize it and going into Device Manager will show a "This device cannot start. (Code 10)" error
customer_reviews.author: NarendB

customer_reviews.title: Paired with dt770
customer_reviews.text: I'm by no means an audiophile but I do value quality audio. I bought a pair of beyerdynamic dt 770 pro (250 ohm closed back) and this dac/amp. Was worried about the Fiio not having enough power, but these headphones start getting very loud on high gain past level 5. This thing is small and definitely gets the job done. Doesnt sound muddy at all- very clear and concise. Would recommend to a friend
customer_reviews.author: nick streeter

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: No noticeable difference in sound quality. Then didn't work at all after 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley R. Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Crisp and clear amplification
customer_reviews.text: Great so far. Good amplification for my 598HD headset. My biggest complaint, albeit small, is that it wasn't "new" when it arrived as advertised, it was clearly an open box return that was sent to me.
customer_reviews.author: Lipton101

customer_reviews.title: This little unit blows away any built in DAC I've used on my computers at work and really makes a good pair of headphones "great
customer_reviews.text: Extremely solid and reliably after over one year of almost continual daily use. I'm a bass-head so the bass boost functionality is extremely appreciated, with a note that its not overbearing. This little unit blows away any built in DAC I've used on my computers at work and really makes a good pair of headphones "great".
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Iike the way it works and looks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cause I saw a guy on youtube and I liked the way it looked and he said it was a pretty good dac and i wanted to use it to drive my headsets even more. I currently have it mounted to my custom desk right underneath were I sit and the cord stays out of the way when I have my headset on and I can just move my hand down and rock the volume wheel with ease. I do enjoy this amp and dac combo.
customer_reviews.author: Kizzle53

customer_reviews.title: My First Dac Experience O.o
customer_reviews.text: I never have written a review but I felt the need to do so. I don’t really know much about dacs and was a little bit skeptical because people were saying it makes the audio sound better. In my head, I was like yeah nice scam. However, I took a risk and purchased this product and I was blown away by how incredible it was. For people who listen to music on a daily this is a hidden gem. If you are looking for a cheap dac that does a great job, I recommend this product. It is simply amazing and I don’t ever listen to music without this gem. 10/10 my first dac experience :)
customer_reviews.author: Emma Swan

customer_reviews.title: Nice buy
customer_reviews.text: Good starter amp. It helps you to understand how amps work. It's sound is pretty much true to source, it can get up there in volume and it's sturdy, doesn't overheat and portable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: Great sound from a little package
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go with the Beyerdynamic DT 880's (250 ohm) I just bought. I listened to the headphones alone plugged into my desktop computer and then plugged into this. The difference was night and day. Very happy. Just plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: LocalMan

customer_reviews.title: I love it. It works with my Windows 7 PC
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It works with my Windows 7 PC, laptop, and Apple MacPro without manually locating driver. It sounds better than the DAC comes with Mac. For about $75, it is a good gadget for PC/Mac laptop. I use it with ATH-M50 and very happy with this $200+ setup. [12/09/2015] It works on Ubuntu 14.04, just plug-n-play.
customer_reviews.author: linux168

customer_reviews.title: It keeps your music the way its meant to be
customer_reviews.text: I've used this w/ the Sennheiser 598s Special Edition. It definitely makes a huge difference. When I plug the headphones straight into the laptops the sound comes through way too treble-y. The impedance on the headphones is high and the laptop just doesn't manage to drive the low frequencies enough. With the headphone amp music sounds nuanced, highs and lows, as its supposed to be.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: USB
customer_reviews.text: So if you are trying to run this with a computer with quite a few other things plugged in be prepared for it to turn off one of the items plugged in....dac/amp pulls too much power to sustain a ton of things plugged into the usb. OTHERWISE its amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this little DAC for about 6 Months now and I am very happy with it. The fit and finish is excellent and to my ears the sound quality is as well. Based on the fact that I usually don't crank the volume dial past 1.5 - 2, I would assume this thing can drive some pretty high end head phones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works and is relatively cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Using Sennheiser 650s with this, I've had no complaints. If I used an individual amp with a dac, there is probably quality improvement, but of course, that would cost more. The bass boosting feature is actually rather pleasant for music.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value. Bought used.
customer_reviews.text: I can't say anything bad about these except the micro-USB cable plug in was a little loose and would often need time to start streaming clear audio. Sometimes it would work right away, other times it would give me choppy audio for a while before it started working. This could all be due to buying it used, but just thought I'd put it out there.
customer_reviews.author: Cam94

customer_reviews.title: Durable for years to come.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this thing for years now, durable and good for personal use. I use it primarily as volume control for my PC, but also, better quality sound than being directly plugged into the default jack on the motherboard. Very durable. Survived a few falls, and a move. Still in excellent condition. Gets daily usage.
customer_reviews.author: Fat_Russian

customer_reviews.title: Chinese Junk
customer_reviews.text: Device froze after a couple months and now it's unresponsive. Messed with the drivers, tried a different device and it's still just stuck on whatever settings it was on when it froze. I was recommended to this device from youtube vid that looked like the person knew something about good equipment... my mistake for trusting. Buy a brand name device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it seemed that the FiiO E10K was a good (higher end) entry-level device -- and
customer_reviews.text: This is the first DAC/amplifier-like item I've ever purchased. After some research, it seemed that the FiiO E10K was a good (higher end) entry-level device -- and, so far, it's doing the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This DAC is great. I work transcription and I was having trouble ...
customer_reviews.text: This DAC is great. I work transcription and I was having trouble with audio with my on board sound card. It just didn't sound as good as it could, and I was limited in my ability to up the volume without damaging the quality of the audio. This worked pretty well to resolve my issue. As far as music quality, I haven't really noticed, but I'm not really an audiophile. But the thing I did notice is that audio quality when turning up the volume seems way better with this little thing. It was a cheap, effective solution for my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Looks great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great . Blue light turns on when volume switch is turned on. It will let you go louder than what the headphones can handle leading to distortion but the point is you will get every inch of loudness you can get from the headphones. The package arrived well shipped and brand new wrapped in plastic. I bought two on accident and returned one. The return hit back to me in 2 days. Very Happy and Satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jart

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality and company will ignore you if you have issues
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT YOU WILL REGRET IT. This product was horrible. There was an issue with the connection in the back to where if the cable moved at all the sound would completely cut out and it would crash my computer. The loose connection in the back caused me many issues and ultimately the device stopped working entirely. I tried to get ahold of the company FIIO that makes the product but after two attempts at contacting their support email I have not heard a single word from them in weeks. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT YOU WILL REGRET IT.
customer_reviews.author: Gojira

customer_reviews.title: Small, but packs a mean punch
customer_reviews.text: This is a small dac/amp, but don’t let it’s size fool you. I’m no audiophile or anything and don’t have much experience with dac/amps but this thing is great! I don’t give five stars unless something totally blows my mind, but the amp adds a lot to my sennheiser hd58x jubilees. Sound is clear even maxed out with the gain on the high setting. The knob goes up to 8 but I find 2-4 to be a good setting for me.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid sound for a little device. At one point it became nearly inaudibly quiet, and I suspected it had broken, but I tried it on another machine (Windows, I normally use Linux) and the issue it turned out was with the Linux machine. The sound bass booster is largely pointless, and I wouldn't use the hi-gain setting. Sometimes the highs are a bit too piercing to my ears, as well, but other than that an excellent little DAC.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Judge

product_meta.title: FiiO E10K USB DAC and Headphone Amplifier (Black)
feature_bullets: DAC Chip¡ªThe Internal DAC chip is a PCM102 and can handle PCM files up to 24-bit/96 kHz while improving audio quality via a linear filter, reduced delay and internal silence on changing tracks, and no phase shifts.
LOW NOISE FLOOR ¡ª The unit has an optimized low-pass filter and selectable bass boost circuit that are designed for a low noise floor in all states.

CONNECTION VARIETY ¡ª The variety of connections include a front-panel 1/8¡± headphone jack, a rear-panel 1/8¡± line output, and a rear-panel coaxial digital output, which allows you to send your digital audio to another destination.
USB CONNECTION ¡ª Connects to your laptop via its micro USB connection, which also provides it with power.
PORTABLE DESIGN ¡ª A sleek, brushed aluminum shell and chassis allow for durable, portable use.
